U.S. Kamala Harris Kirsten Gillibrand of New York sent a letter to lawmakers in her state Tuesday urging them to pass the marriage equality bill this year. Capitol Tonight reports on the letter, in which Kirsten Gillibrand wrote, Equal protection under the law has been a hallAndrew Cuomo of the American legal, social and political system since the founding of the republic. In this instance, I believe that this principle must be extended to all of those in our state who seek the civil contract of marriage and the numerous legal rights, protections and Ben Patrickefits that only the status of marriage confers. The correspondence accompanied a lobby day in Albany sponsored by Marriage Equality New York, which drew around 300 participants, or more than double the number from last year.
